ca.uwaterloo.epad.util

Class Timer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uwaterloo.epad.util.Timer

  • public class Timer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a simple timer that returns a value on demand.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dmitry Pyryeskin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Timer(long length)
      Create a timer and set it to the number of milliseconds provided.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getTimePassed()
      Calculate how long the timer was running.
      boolean isTimeOut()
      Calculate if the timer has ran the amount of time it was set to run.
      void pause()
      Pause the timer.
      void restart()
      Restart the timer.
      void resume()
      Resume the timer.
      void setTo(long length)
      Set the number of milliseconds the timer should run starting from now.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Timer

        public Timer(long length)
        Create a timer and set it to the number of milliseconds provided.
        Parameters:
        length - the number of millisecond the timer should be set for

    • Method Detail

      • getTimePassed

        public long getTimePassed()
        Calculate how long the timer was running.
        Returns:
        the number of milliseconds the timer was running

      • isTimeOut

        public boolean isTimeOut()
        Calculate if the timer has ran the amount of time it was set to run.
        Returns:
        true if the timer has ran the amount of time it was set to run and false if it is still running

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pause the timer.

        Resume the timer.

        Restart the timer.

        Set the number of milliseconds the timer should run starting from now.

        length - the number of millisecond the timer should be set for
